column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/bbfce8a4c9e7541d06dcc857dd0a82ec14d92180 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
I cannot discern from your commit message, or the patch, why this is a "fix", or is needed at all.\n
@diaplo Can you link to the standard that would make this nonstandard? I cannot find any of these reasons in BIP0022 in a quick glance.\n

ACK

Good to be clear as to where the non-standardness is given scriptPubKeys are allowed to have non-standard pushdata's. If that changes in the future we can create an additional scriptPubKey-non-canonical-push message.
See above links, I just used the wording that WAS already used for the other reason strings... I don't claim there is a BIP for this :-P.\n
